SVGFEDropShadowElement.summary: The SVGFEDropShadowElement interface corresponds to the feDropShadow element.

SVGFEDropShadowElementDx.summary: The dx read-only property of the interface reflects the {{SVGAttr("dx")}} attribute of the given {{SVGElement("feDropShadow")}} element.

SVGFEDropShadowElementDy.summary: The dy read-only property of the interface reflects the {{SVGAttr("dy")}} attribute of the given {{SVGElement("feDropShadow")}} element.

SVGFEDropShadowElementHeight.summary: The height read-only property of the interface describes the vertical size of an SVG filter primitive as a .

remarks.para: It reflects the height filter primitive attribute. The attribute is a <length> or a <percentage> relative to the height of the filter region. The default value is 100%. The property value is a length in user coordinate system units.

-
-CSS filter-function/drop-shadow function
-CSS box-shadow property
-CSS text-shadow property
-CSS blend-mode data type
-CSS mix-blend-mode property

SVGFEDropShadowElementIn1.summary: The in1 read-only property of the interface reflects the {{SVGAttr("in")}} attribute of the given {{SVGElement("feDropShadow")}} element.

SVGFEDropShadowElementResult.summary: The result read-only property of the interface describes the assigned name of an SVG filter primitive as a .

remarks.para: It reflects the {{SVGAttr("result")}} attribute. The attribute value is a custom-ident. If supplied, then graphics that result from processing this filter primitive can be referenced by an {{SVGAttr("in")}} attribute on a subsequent filter primitive within the same {{SVGElement("filter")}} element.

If no result attribute is defined, the filter's result.baseVal and result.animVal are empty strings, and the output of the <feDropShadow> filter will only be available for re-use as the implicit input into the next filter primitive if that filter primitive provides no value for its in attribute.

-
-custom-ident data type
-CSS filter-function/drop-shadow function
-CSS box-shadow property
-CSS text-shadow property
-CSS blend-mode data type
-CSS mix-blend-mode property

SVGFEDropShadowElementSetStdDeviation.summary: The setStdDeviation() method of the interface sets the values for the {{SVGAttr("stdDeviation")}} attribute.

SVGFEDropShadowElementStdDeviationX.summary: The stdDeviationX read-only property of the interface reflects the (possibly automatically computed) X component of the {{SVGAttr("stdDeviation")}} attribute of the given {{SVGElement("feDropShadow")}} element.

SVGFEDropShadowElementStdDeviationY.summary: The stdDeviationY read-only property of the interface reflects the (possibly automatically computed) Y component of the {{SVGAttr("stdDeviation")}} attribute of the given {{SVGElement("feDropShadow")}} element.

SVGFEDropShadowElementWidth.summary: The width read-only property of the interface describes the horizontal size of an SVG filter primitive as a .

remarks.para: It reflects the width filter primitive attribute. The attribute is a <length> or a <percentage> relative to the width of the filter region. The default value is 100%. The property value is a length in user coordinate system units.

-
-CSS filter-function/drop-shadow function
-CSS box-shadow property
-CSS text-shadow property
-CSS blend-mode data type
-CSS mix-blend-mode property

SVGFEDropShadowElementX.summary: The x read-only property of the interface describes the horizontal coordinate of the position of an SVG filter primitive as a .

remarks.para: It reflects the {{SVGAttr("x")}} attribute of the feDropShadow element, which creates a drop shadow of an input image. The attribute is a <length> or <percentage>. The <coordinate> is a length in the user coordinate system that is the given distance from the origin of the user coordinate system along the x-axis. If the x attribute is a percent value, the property value is relative to the width of the filter region in user coordinate system units.

-
-CSS filter-function/drop-shadow function
-CSS box-shadow property
-CSS text-shadow property
-CSS blend-mode data type
-CSS mix-blend-mode property

SVGFEDropShadowElementY.summary: The y read-only property of the interface describes the vertical coordinate of the position of an SVG filter primitive as a .

remarks.para: It reflects the {{SVGAttr("y")}} attribute of the feDropShadow element, which creates a drop shadow of an input image. The attribute is a <length> or <percentage>. The <coordinate> is a length in the user coordinate system that is the given distance from the origin of the filter along the y-axis. If the y attribute is a percent value, the property value is a relative to the height of the filter region in user coordinate system units. The default value is 0.

-
-CSS filter-function/drop-shadow function
-CSS box-shadow property
-CSS text-shadow property
-CSS blend-mode data type
-CSS mix-blend-mode property
